item.title: Tree-Based Imputation
item.description: It involves building a decision tree model using the non-missing data and then using the tree model to predict the missing values. Here are some pros and cons of tree-based imputation: Pros: It can handle non-linear relationships between the variables and non-monotonic missing data patterns. It can impute both continuous and categorical variables. It can be less prone to bias compared to other imputation methods. Cons: It can be computationally intensive, especially when dealing with large datasets.
